730818f-a.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [Inwood Hill Park.]
730818f-a.text:
Henry Hudson Bridge: A set of 2 views of the concrete base under construction at the edge of Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan. Slightly north of same is the Railroad Bridge that carries the New York Central tracks across the Harlem River. In the right background is visible the New Jersey Shore.
September 31 [sic], 1935.
View 2:-September 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(Not a dry mount item).
730818f-a.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730818f-b.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [Inwood Hill Park.]
730818f-b.text:

P. L. Sperr.
(Not a dry mount item).
730818f-b.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730819f-a.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge.
730819f-a.text:
Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge: A view southeastward of same while under construction. Photographers vantage point is in the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx. On the far side of the Harlem River is Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
(Not a dry mount item).
730819f-a.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730820f-a.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge - [Inwood Hill Park.]
730820f-a.text:
Henry Hudson Memorial Bridge: A view southwestward of this new structure that will carry an extension of Riverside Drive across to the Borough of the Bronx. This new highway will also bear the name, Henry Hudson. Photographers vantage point is in the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx and he shows Inwood Hill Park on the far side of the Harlem River.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
(not a dry mount item).
NEG. # 3030
730820f-a.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730821f-a.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [Harlem River.]
730821f-a.text:
Henry Hudson Bricge over the Harlem River, seen from the Hudson River. In the foreground is the New York Central Railroad Bridge.
1937
Views 1, 2
P. L. Sperr
730821f-a.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730821f-b.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [Harlem River.]

730822f-b.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [View of the bridge over Harlem River, linking Spuyten Duyvil Hill, Bronx with Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan.]
730822f-b.text:
(1)
Henry Hudson Bridge: A view southwestward from Spuyten Duyvil Hill, Bronx. The bridge spans the Harlem River linking the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx with Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan.
May 25, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg. # 1796
(2)
The same, a more distant view.
May 25, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view southward toward Manhattan.
May 25, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
730822f-b.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730824f-c.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [View of the bridge over Harlem River, linking Spuyten Duyvil Hill, Bronx with Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan.]
730824f-c.text:
(1)
Henry Hudson Bridge, spanning the Harlem River, between Inwood Hill Park, Manhattan and Spuyten Duyvil Hill, the Bronx. The view is west toward the palisades of New Jersey and shows, also, the New York Central Railroad bridge (left).
August 2, 1939
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The Henry Hudson Pridge and New York Central Railroad bridge (open), seen from Spuyten Duyvil Hill, the Bronx. In
the background is the shore of New Jersey.
July 15, 1939
P. L. Sperr
(3)
Viewing northeastward from the Hudson River across the New York Central Railroad and Henry Hudson Bridge, toward
Spuyten Duyvil.
August 2, 1939
P. L. Sperr
730824f-c.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730826f-a.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge - [General view of Henry Hudson Bridge, Harlem River in foreground, Hudson River in background, Inwood Hill Park to the left.]
730826f-a.text:
PLEASE CREDIT TRIBOROUGH BRIDGE AND TUNNEL AUTHORITY
Photo No. H-10 Date Taken 8/7/71
Description: General View of Henry Hudson Bridge, Harlem River in foreground, Hudson River in background. Inwood
Hill Park to the left.
730826f-a.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730823f-b.title: Bridges - Henry Hudson Bridge.
730823f-b.text:
(1)
Henry Hudson Bridge: A view east from Independence
Avenue, in the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx.
May 25, 1937
P. L. Sperr
(2) and (3)
Two views, looking westward on the Harlem River, of the bridge, Spuyten Duyvil Hill, the Bronx, and the New Jersey shore on the west bank of the Hudson River. The apartment house is the Villa Victoria, and below the hill is visible the Spuyten Duyvil station of the New York Central Railroad.
August 21, 1939
P. L. Sperr
730823f-b.folder: Henry Hudson Bridge, New York, N.Y.
